fields.description:
When setting the project lead (http://docs.atlassian.com/rpc-jira-plugin/latest/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/beans/RemoteProject.html#setLead(java.lang.String)) using the soap API, the default assignee is also set (to project lead). 

What's worse, the 'People' Admin UI shows the incorrect value.

To replicate:
# Configure JIRA to allow unassigned issues
# Set a TEST project, with a project lead but no default assignee.
# Run the attached script (you might need to change user or project)
# Note that in 'people', the default assignee is still unassigned.
# Edit the people, and edit the default assignee. Notice that when editing, the default assignee is project lead.
# Create an issue. Notice that the default assignee is the project lead.
fields.summary: SOAP API set project lead also sets default assignee

fields.description:
When I use the Eclipse connector to submit the time spent in an issue, the connector behaves in strange way with custom fields that sore multiple data (Multiple Select, etc).
For instance if an issue has a custom field with these values: AAAA,BBBB,CCCC, after submitting the time spent using the connector the issue will have only the last value: CCCC.
This happens with all custom fields (that store multiple data) in the issue.
If the custom field has got only one value, this won't be affected.

A user has proposed a fix to the connector

http://bitbucket09.managed.contegix.com/atlassian/connector-eclipse/pull-request/1/fix-update-issue-with-custom-fields

Please, can you solve it?

Thanks
fields.summary: Eclipse Jira Connector deletes data from custom field with multiple data
Append the REST WADL with formal description of the JSON format

fields.description:
At the current moment, JIRA do not have any restrictions for attachment files, which allows users to upload malicious file into JIRA issues. This can be a problem when we open an attachments using Mozilla Firefox, since the browser allows us to open attachments using web browser. The steps to reproduce the problem is as below:
- Access JIRA using Firefox
- A sample HTML file containing malicious script is uploaded in JIRA 
{code}
<script>alert("This is XSS");</script>
{code}
!scshot1.png!
- Open the file with FireFox
!scshot2.png!
- The script is running inside the browser
!scshot3.png!
fields.summary: XSS Vulnerabilities in JIRA Attachments?
Create Project is missing in REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27254].
  {panel}

As a user, I want to search for issues that were in progress on the last working day, to provide context for my team's daily stand-up meeting.

Currently the best I can do with JQL is "status WAS IN ("In Progress") AFTER startOfDay(-1)", which does not work on a Monday because the last working day was 3 days ago.

I therefore want a "startOfLastWorkingDay()" function to return the start of the last working day.  When called on a Monday, it would return the start of the preceding Friday.  It should also skip over registered non-working holidays.

Alternatively, I want a "-1wd" syntax to subtract working days from the date, such that startOfDay("-1wd") executed on a Monday returns the start of the previous Friday.
fields.summary: JQL function to return start of last working day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27248].
  {panel}

Customer is asking to include a JQL function where it'll be able to get all issues in a chain of linked issues in a report in JIRA OnDemand.

Basically, a function similar to "linkedAllIssues" provided by JQL Tricks Plugin where a search like this can be performed:

I have one issue "ABC-1" which is linked to from "ABC-2"
"ABC-2" is linked to from "XYZ-1" and "XYZ-2" 
"XYZ-2" is linked to from "MNO-4"

Thank you.
fields.summary: JQL function "llinkedAllIssues" to link all linked issues related to an issue

fields.description:
We use Jira for our ITIL based servicedesk and have a lot of issues/incidents created by email (from users outside our company). As we don't have unlimited licenses we have createusers=false and reporterusername set to an "email-user".

We also use an AD for all our users in the company (a few hundred). Only a few of these (servicedesk and developers) also have access to Jira by being in the necessary Jira groups defined through the AD.

Whenever a user (in the AD, but not in any of the jira/project related groups) sends an email Jira won't pickup the email.

The log shows the following: 

[atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice] The message has been rejected: Reporter (xxxxx) does not have permission to create an issue. Message rejected.


This might be by design, but I really think Jira should pick up the email anyway and put the reporter as the person specified in "reporterusername" (if createusers is set to false and if reporterusername is set). Emails might get missed if this is not the case.
fields.summary: Emails rejected if user doesn't have access to project.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* change a user's language to something other than English
* go to the "Notifications" tab, e.g. http://localhost:8090/jira/plugins/servlet/project-config/HSP/notifications

Looking at the code shows that we are calling {{EventType.getName()}} instead of {{EventType.getTranslatedName()}} in {{ProjectNotificationContextProvider}}.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27223].
  {panel}

When creating a "Internal with LDAP authentication" directory in JIRA, we have the message:

{quote}
Configure Internal with LDAP Authentication User Directory

JIRA can use LDAP for user authentication only. To be able to log in to JIRA with this configuration, users must either be created first in JIRA, or the option 'Copy User on First Login' can be checked to automatically add them to JIRA's internal directory. Copied users can subsequently be modified in Confluence, but modifications will not be reflected on the LDAP server.

Groups and memberships from the LDAP server will not be used. However, users from LDAP can be added to groups maintained in JIRA's internal directory.
{quote}

Let's say the user's info is the following:
* uid=testuser
* mail=testuser@ldapemail.com

If we try to change an attribute for one of the users in this delegated directory, for example, the email address (changing from *testuser@ldapemail.com* to *testuser@jiraemail.com*), next time the users logs in JIRA, the email address is set to the *testuser@ldapemail.com*. 

This behaviour also can be observed by editing the user's Full Name.
fields.summary: LDAP users from delegated directory cannot change their information though JIRA UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27222].
  {panel}

For adding things, I think the new pop-up add panel is great.

However, when I am on the page showing the entire issue, and I click Edit, I'm really surprised to be constrained just to the add sheet. Part of the benefit of the small panel is that it doesn't completely block what's going on. However, in the case of editing the issue that you're currently looking at, it is not only odd, but frustrating.

In particular, I lose a ton of screen real-estate showing "through" the old information which I'm currently editing, and it constrains my ability to both view and edit the information for that ticket.

As I indicated, for adding, it's great, but then I would expect that if the "smaller form" of the page weren't sufficient, I could just click on the issue and I'd be able to edit in my full window, which isn't the case.
fields.summary: 5.0 quick create quick edit is great for adding, bad for editing

fields.description:
When there is two or more Date Time custom field, the second Date Time custom field does not take the current time.  

Steps to replicate:
# Create two Date Time custom field
# Add those two custom fields to create issue screen (It can be any screen actually)
# Select the current time for one of the custom field
** As an example (cf1.png), the date time custom field takes the current time, which is 2:22AM
# Wait one minute for the current to change
# The date time custom field does not +show+ the current time value
** As an example (cf2.png), the date time custom field takes the previous time (2:22AM), but not the current time

In JIRA 3.x, the second date time custom field would take the current time.
fields.summary: Date time picker custom field does not display the current time

I want to change the color of the header bar so I go to Administration, Look and Feel (http://localhost:8081/secure/admin/EditLookAndFeel!default.jspa)
and then click Update to change the values. I scroll down and click on Edit Configuration button. I expected to be given editable fields for the colors and a color picker as in previous releases. Instead I was taken back to the previous page.

My mistake was that I should I have expanded the Customize Colors and Dates section, edited the values there and then clicked Update.

fields.description:
If you turn off "User Searching By Full Name" in "General Configuration" you can no longer add users via the Project Member Roles interface

Why would you do this? Well, it's related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7776

Ideally, you would be able to define a project scope for a user-picker, but you can't. If you have a group of users who should not see each other in your instance, your best option (that I can tell) to manage this is: 

(1) Turn off the auto-pop on the user-picker fields via the General Configuration interface and
(2) Limit Browse Users to the group who should see ALL users in the system

When you do this, though, adding users becomes very lame (ideally, the auto-pop would be definable per project), or in the case of defining member roles on a project, broken. 

There is a work-around, which is to add a member to a project through his/ her user profile, but this takes twice as long. 

I would assume that if JIRA-7776 were addressed, this would either no longer be a problem or would be addressed at the same time.
fields.summary: If you turn off "User Searching By Full Name" in "General Configuration" you can no longer add users via the Project Member Roles interface

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27215].
  {panel}

Improve the documentation [Connecting to an Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication].

Our doc current says: "On LDAP, all that the application does is to check the password."

But if we use the option "Copy Users in the first login", information like email address, first name, last name is retrieved. 

After the users is copied, if we edit its email for example, to an email address that doesn't match the one in LDAP, next time the users logs in JIRA, the username is changed back to the one in LDAP.

Our documentation needs to reflect this behavior.

Thanks!

Clarissa.
fields.summary: Improve the documentation Connecting to an Internal Directory with LDAP Authentication

fields.description:
In large JIRA sites, users may experience performance degradation in the following situations:

* Viewing search results in either the [Issue Navigator|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+Issue+Navigator] or [Issue Filters|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=185729481], which retrieve more than 25,000 issues sorted by date.
* For projects with more than 25,000 issues, viewing sections of the [summary|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Browsing+a+Project%27s+Summary] page that list issues sorted by date - for example, the 'Issues: Updated recently' section.

Our settings are
jira.date.picker.java.format: MM/dd/yyyy
jira.date.picker.javascript.format: %m/%d/%Y

If a user enters a date with a 2-digit year, e.g. 2/20/12, the system does not respond with a meaningful error message.

* When creating an issue a generic error message is displayed at the top of the screen: "Error creating issue: Error occurred while storing issue."
* When updating and issue an exception is shown at the top of the screen: 
{noformat}
Exception occurred: com.atlassian.jira.exception.UpdateException: com.atlassian.jira.JiraException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while updating: ... (SQL Exception while setting value: (Only dates between January 1, 1753 and December 31, 9999 are accepted.))
{noformat}

Expected behavior is that the user should be notified that the date format is incorrect and what the correct format is.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27202].
  {panel}

Hi,

When you release in Rapid Board (kanban mode) and several Rapid Boards are using more or less the same projects, you easily run inte name space problems. A better approach would be to use separate "Global Fix Version" attribute(s) but such version attributs would be a conceptual new thing in JIRA. 

These things influence the way we should map JIRA projects over sections of our product structure so it is really important.

Regards,
Ruchi

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Applinks Issue:  https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-1006

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a user 'admin' with the group 'jira-administrators' only
# Create 'confluence-administrators' and 'confluence-users' group in JIRA
# Set Confluence to use JIRA as 'Remote JIRA directory' and use it as the primary directory
# Set the user 'admin' in Confluence so that it have all the administrative permission (Confluence Administrator, System Administrator and Space Admin) with the group 'jira-administrator' only (The other default administrative permission for Confluence groups are not removed)
# Setup the Application Links between JIRA and Confluence with Trusted Applications for both Incoming and Outgoing Authentications
# Try to set the Project Application Links at {{JIRA Administration >> Project >> <Project_name> >> Settings >> Configure Application Links}} to Confluence Space (No permission error):"Sorry, there are no links for this user available, check your permission configuration of the remote application."
!project_app_links.png!
# Trying to set the Space Application Link from Confluence at {{Confluence Space Admin >> Application Links}} to JIRA is working
# Give the default administrative group 'confluence-administrators' to the user 'admin' in Confluence
# Try to set Project Application Links from JIRA server again works

Why would it still need the Confluence group to administrate Confluence even though Confluence already give the permission to JIRA groups?
fields.summary: Project Application Links permission error

fields.description:
We are using JIRA v.4.4.4. and observed the following.
On editing some issues we see that JIRA inserts "0t" as estimate (see attachement)
"t" is incorrect postfix, so on save JIRA warns that estimate should be corrected.
If user enters 0h and saves the issue, next time editing JIRA agin will show "0t".
Seems it is something with locale. Default language in JIRA is English (UK).
Perhaps it is related to OS default locale.
fields.summary: Wrong estimate format on editing an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27198].
  {panel}

By default, when a user is moving an issue to another project, the reporter of the issue must have a create issue permission

There are times when an issue is needed to be moved to another project, but the reporter should not have the create issue permission for that particular project.  Therefore, I believe there should be a configuration whereby an issue can be moved regardless of the reporter's create issue permission.  The move procedures can only be done by a JIRA administration.

As a scenario:
"I guess I think of it like this: Imagine if you guys created a project for "Issues raised by important customers" - and defined the permissions so that people like me couldn't create issues directly in this project, but a responsible atlassian administrator could move an issue that I raised into this project if I was discovered to be an important customer. Mr Atlassian Admin is carrying out his weekly review and moves 60 issues into this new project - and JIRA requests that he choose a new reporter for all 60 issues. Now you don't know who raised them!"
fields.summary: Move Issue Configuration

fields.description:
Look into com.atlassian.jira.plugin.AbstractConfigurableModuleDescriptor#getObjectConfiguration.
com.atlassian.configurable.XMLObjectConfigurationFactory caches previously stored <properties>.
So whenever you change your <properties> for <report> plugin module in your plugin, you have to restart JIRA or hack ObjectConfigurationFactory to reload properties.
fields.summary: Plugin reloadability issue - Reports properties (ObjectConfigurable) are not refreshed on plugin reload

fields.description: secure/admin/ViewIssueTypes.jspa has three tabs on it. The middle one is "Issue Types Scheme" but actually refers to "Issue Type Schemes". This is confirmed by the first sentence on the screen that shows when you click on that tab.
fields.summary: Middle tab name is incorrect in the ViewIssues page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27166].
  {panel}

You can refer to this ticket: JSP-115535

This would be great to let us select which group of permissions users may have access to.

For example, we have subversion and FishEye plugin in Jira. Currently they are linked to "View Version Control" permission so we could not give specific permission for each plugins.

Our request feature would be to let create group permission for plugins.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if I'm unclear or want more details.

Best regards,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27164].
  {panel}

Hi all,

It would be nice to see in the workflow (available if you click the "View workflow" link) :
* for the old status of the current issue, the date and the assignee.
* the current status
* the available transitions for me
without consulting all, history or activity stream.

This could give us the overview.
fields.summary: View Workflow improvements

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27163].
  {panel}

I have spoken to Sergey Markovich from Plugenta Labs about getting SuggestiMate included as plugin for Jira OnDemand.

They said they are trying to figure out the way for our plugin to be approved for JIRA On Demand and that you guys at Atlassian definitely make important efforts to simplify the process but there are some pretty reasonable considerations on your part regarding running 3rd party plugins in your hosted environment.

I really hope I cna encourage you to sustain your efforts so that eventually SuggestiMate will be available for all JIRA On Demand users, it is an amazing time and sanity saver.

Cheers Nick

Best regards,
Sergey Markovich
Plugenta Labs
http://www.plugenta.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27148].
  {panel}

Currently a user needs to be in the Jira-administrators group to edit the workflow of a project

Once a user is an administrator of a project (such as Project Manager) we would like them to be able to make changes within that project without limitation - so they can edit their own workflows while not affecting others

Current usage means that either support staff that may not have the time or knowledge to update the workflow for an individual project as often as required or we need to add the project manager into jira-administrators, which gives them control over the entire environment - which is not ideal

We would like to be able to define permissions for all elements of projects using permission schemes and users/groups
fields.summary: Add property to allow users not in jira-administrators to edit project workflows

fields.summary: workflow designer: view post functions on transition label => stacktrace
Workflow designer should allow users to change the line type even if the workflow is active

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27145].
  {panel}

Background. Someone modified server.xml(/app/tomcat/conf/server.xml) and ours App's(mentioned above) were unable to start.

I was unable to intepret this information neither form atlassian*.log or catalina.out.

Is it possible to have a different levels of loggings configs for app's so in instance like yesterday we can trace the issue.

Example:
Connection to port 8081 refused please check your server.xml? something like that?

Please let me know if you need any further information.
fields.summary: JIRA/Confluence/Fisheye/Crowd to have various levels of logging for Start-up and Shutdown.

fields.description:
When creating an issue type with a custom icon (using icon URL), if the URL is broken, the icon will be replaced by it's name text instead. This will make the _Issues: Updated recently section_ (in the browse project page) a bit dirty. 

Kindly see the following screenshot for steps to reproduce:
- Create a new issue type, with custom icon (broken URL)
!scshot1.png!
- When creating an issue, we can see that the icon is replaced by it's text name instead:
!scshot2.png!
- In the Browse project screen, the _Issue: Updated recently_ section is not displayed properly
!scshot3.png!

This behavior do not occur on other browser type (eg: Chrome, Safari)
fields.summary: Custom issue type icon is rendered by the name if the icon URL is broken in Firefox 10

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27143].
  {panel}

Hi,

The membersOf() operatorin JQL does not support a lot of operators like : 
{noformat}=

!=

~

!~

>

>=

<

<=

IS

IS NOT

WAS

WAS IN

WAS NOT

WAS NOT IN

CHANGED{noformat}
It would be nice if these operators can be used with membersOf().
fields.summary: JQL membersOf() does not support a lot of operators

fields.description:
When accessing JIRA using FireFox 10, the issue actions will not be working whereby upon clicking on any of the actions such as _View Issue_, _Edit_, _workflow operations_, etc, nothing will occur.

!scshot.png!

The affected gadgets are:
- Filter Results
- Assigned to Me

Steps to reproduce
- Access JIRA 4.4.1 or 4.4.3 using FireFox 10
- Add the Filter Results or Assigned to Me gadget to the dashboard
- Try to click on any of the issue Actions
fields.summary: Issue Actions are not working in the Dashboard Gadget using FireFox 10

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27140].
  {panel}

1. Launch the KeyBoard Short cuts dialog using 'Shift' + '?'
2. Observe that TEmpo and GreenHopper use the same Global Shortcut

'g' and 't'.

!tempo_gh.png!

When both GreenHopper and Tempo are enabled on an instance, this shortcut does nothing.

Disabling one of them, works for another. E.g. If GH is disabled then 'g' and 't' shows the Tempo screen and vice - versa.
fields.summary: Tempo and GH use same Global Shortcut and the shortcut does not work in OnDemand
Re-resolve plugin dependencies when another plugin is installed/upgraded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27138].
  {panel}

Hi Giles

As discussed previously, please update the following pages to include step-by-step instructions, for completing a task such as managing project permissions, first (i.e. at the top) for the following pages:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Screen#DefiningaScreen-fieldtabs (for creating a tab) (/)
* I've decided to leave this one 'as is' since the screenshots (above the step-by-step instructions) demonstrate the purpose behind configuring these field tabs. Since the screenshots also illustrate the example description (which is part of the introductory blurb about configuring field tabs), I thought it best to leave them where they were. I agree though (i.e. in reference to the other doc pages in this issue) that it's better to move tables of reference information below their step-by-step instructions, as their content is too specific and do not form part of the introductory material.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Project+Permissions

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Labelling+an+Issue

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Modifying+Multiple+%28%27Bulk%27%29+Issues
* Update outdated screenshots on this page too.

Cheers

Geoff
fields.summary: Update JIRA documentation pages to have step-by-step instructions first
Outdated time zones in JIRA

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*
# Configure application link between JIRA and Bamboo. Authentication method could be trusted, Oauth or basic.
# Add gadget subscription to JIRA so that you can add external gadgets from Bamboo in to JIRA
# Add gadgets such as the Bamboo Plan Summary chart or the Bamboo plans
# The gadgets should workk fine in JIRA
# Restart JIRA and you will be greeted with the error message "This gadget was uninstalled by the administrator. Please delete it from your dashboard" in place of the gadgets. See screenshot
# Delete the application link and re-add again and the problem will be fixed.

This can be troublesome considering the fac that we will have to always drop and recreate application link
fields.summary: Bamboo Gadgets in JIRA fails to load upon restart with an error message "This gadget was uninstalled by the administrator. Please delete it from your dashboard"

fields.description:
1) Bring up Quick Create in any browser.
2) Switch the issue type to something not the default.
3) Change the project.

The issue type switches back to the default for a noticeable period (1/2 second in FF10 on a local instance, longer in older browsers and slower instances).

This is a regression caused by the fix for JRA-27029, it never used to do this.
fields.summary: Issue Type momentarily switches back to default when changing projects in Quick Create

fields.description:
1) In IE8, go to the full-page Create Issue dialog.
2) Pick a project and pick an issue type.
3) Change to another project that also has that issue type.

The issue type is no longer available for selection.

See video using QA data:
http://screencast.com/t/HgQdolFWAC
(What all the mouse-pointer-waving is trying to indicate is that Bulk Move 1 has the Improvement issue type, but if you select Improvement in the QA project first, then switch to Bulk Move 1, it reverts to Bug and Improvement is no longer in the list).
fields.summary: Full-page create issue page loses issue types from the list in IE8
